data.title: Upcoming Events — St. Stephen's Anglican Church
data.text:
Happy Canada Day Service

This Sunday we will be celebrating Canada Day at the 10:00 a.m. service. To add to the spirit of the celebration, if you have anything red to wear, please do so. All are welcomed as we come together as a diverse community to celebrate, reflect on and enjoy our nation.

View Event →

Women's Afternoon Group

All women are invited to come to our Monday afternoon women’s group. We enjoy cards, board games and fellowship. Tea, coffee and treats are served.

View Event →

Outdoor Service and Church Picnic

Come rain or shine we will hold our outdoor service and church picnic on the labyrinth at the Watson Street side of the church. Well …. if it rains, both the service and picnic meal will be in the basement. Bring your lawn chair, hat, water, and sunscreen. Come and enjoy all the trimmings of a church picnic - hot dogs, hamburgers, chips, cookies, ice cream. Games for children. No need to sign up, just come and a warm welcome awaits you.

View Event →

The Big Give

God loves you, and we love you, and that’s just how it should be! Join us for a nation wide expression of God’s love for all. This giant garage sale has clothes, shoes, toys, small appliances, and breakfast of coffee, tea, juice and muffins. And it’s all free!

View Event →

Pentecost Sunday with Combined Service and Community Lunch

To complete the Easter celebrations, our Pentecost Service will be held with our friends from Jesus is Lord church (who share our building). The service will be followed by a combined lunch. You are invited to come and celebrate the diversity and beauty of our community.

Please note that the end time of this service as posted is approximate.

View Event →

We are hiring!! Join the team as a Children/Youth Ministry Coordinator

We are hiring a Children/Youth Ministry Co-Ordinator

We are looking for a coordinator to work with the children and youth of our parish. A full description of the position is found by clicking on the link below: https://dioceseottawa.bamboohr.com/careers/112#:~:text=https%3A//dioceseottawa.bamboohr.com/careers/112

Applications are due on or before June 4, 2024

View Event →

Make doves for Pentecost - A special workshop!

Would you like to make origami doves for Pentecost? We will make the doves at a special workshop to hang up for the better part of the season of Pentecost.

No prior origami experience is necessary - all materials will be provided and we guide you through the folding process and help you create your own unique doves. No need to sign up, just show up.

This is a great opportunity to connect with others in our community and participate in a hands-on activity that carries a profound message.

Note that the end time given for this event is approximate.

View Event →

Branches of Hope - A Diocesan Tree planting project

We invite you to join the Branches of Hope project of the Dioesan Working Group of the Primate’s World Relief and Development Fund (PWDRF).

The project sims to help “green” the Anglican Diocese of Ottawa through the distribution of tree seedlings. Funds raised for the project will be given to our PWRDF partner in Uganda.

To read more about the project, and to how you can obtain your tree, please read the poster.

View Event →

National Asian Month Special Worship Service

Our parishioner, Bea Tanaka will be our guest preacher for this special service to celebrate National Asian Month.

Members of our congregation who are of Asian descent will host a light lunch.

Note that the end time of this service is an approximate

View Event →

Trivia Night by Zoom in Support of Campus Ministry at Algonquin College

We hope you can join us for our Zoom Trivia Night (multiple choice questions!) in support of Campus Ministry at Algonquin College: Friday, April 5 at 7:00 PM. You can either organize a team of your own or join others who will be participating, all in support of the ecumenical Christian Campus Ministry that serves the students and staff at Algonquin College. Cost: Freewill donation (all donations are tax-receiptable).

The Zoom link, (please see below) will be live at 6:45 PM on Friday, April 5.

https://us02web.zoom.us/j/83378395987?pwd=djcrWGYrSFlnOEpiUjVFT04wWlljUT09

If you are unable to attend but would like to make a tax-receiptable donation, you can do so through our CanadaHelps website:

https://www.canadahelps.org/en/charities/algonquin-college-campus-ministry/

For more information, please contact Jack Wilson @ wilsonjohns@rogers.com

View Event →

Palm Sunday Bake Sale

Following the Palm Sunday service during coffee hour, come and enjoy our Palm Sunday Bake Sale. Delicious Easter and other baking will be for sale. If you would like to contribute baking, please contact: jccollett@bell.net.

View Event →

An Evening of Dessert Under the Stars

Dave Chisholm (President of the Ottawa Chapter of the Royal Astronomical Society of Canada) will speak to us about the total solar eclipse which will occur in Ottawa on April 8, 2024. Bring our favourite dessert (pie, case, cookies etc) to share. This promises to be an interesting evening.

View Event →

Women's Afternoon with Martha

All women are invited to an afternoon of games, sweets and fellowship. You can enjoy a game of euchre, bridge, board games - or just sit and chat with friends. Tea, coffee and sweets will be served. No need to register, just show up in the lower hall.

View Event →

2024 Annual Vestry Meeting

All parishioners are asked to do their best to attend the Annual Vestry to be held on March 3, 11:30 a.m. Your presence and participation are important as we come together to reflect on the past year, discuss important matters, and chart the course for the future of our parish. The Annual Vestry report will be emailed to those on the parish list, and is also available in the office.

LUNCH

Participants are requested to bring a brown bag lunch to enjoy before and during the meeting. Fellowship will serve coffee, tea and cookies as usual..

View Event →

World Day of Prayer - At Christ Church Bells Corners

Please join with us Friday, March 1 at Christ Church Bells Corners for an ecumenical World Day of Prayer service starting at 1:00 p.m. The World Day of Prayer is a worldwide ecumenical movement of Informed Prayer and Prayerful Action that has taken place annually for a century. Each year the worship service is designed by a different country, a process that can take up to 5 years.

The address for Christ Church Bells Corners is 3861 Old Richmond Road, Nepean ON K2H 5C1. Phone: 613 829 1826.

View Event →

Evening online book study - The Practice of the Presence of God

Join us this Lent to explore “The Practice of the Presence of God” by Brother Lawrence via Zoom. These evening sessions will include reading and replection, followed by daily devotions, with discussion and shared insights when we meet .

A few paperback books will be available. You may also download a free e-book from this link: The Practice of the Presence of God: A 40-Day Devotion Based on Brother Lawrence's The Practice of the Presence of God (Includes Entire Book) eBook : Lawrence, Brother, Vermilye, Alan: Amazon.ca: Kindle Store.

Also available on Audio:The Practice of the Presence of God (FULL Audiobook) (youtube.com)

Information on registering to receive a Zoom link for the session will be sent out in the newsletter.

The sessions will run: February 21, 28 and March 6, 13, 2024

View Event →

Morning Eucharist, Meditation and Study

As part of our Lenten journey, all are invited to join a four week study that will provide an opportunity for Communion, Meditation, Study and a light lunch.

10.30 am - Holy Eucharist in the Chapel

11:00 am - Meditation and Study

12:00 pm - a light lunch will be served

Different study material will be used in the evening online session, on Zoom.

Dates for the study are: Wednesday February 21, 28 and March 6, 13, 2024

View Event →

Evening Ash Wednesday Servide

You are invited to receive ashes and begin your Lenten observance at this evening Ash Wednesday Service.

Please note that the end time of the service as given is approximate.

View Event →

Day Time Ash Wednesday Service

You are invited to observe the beginning of your Lenten observance and receive ashes at this morning Ash Wednesday Service. Please note that the end time of this service as given is approximate.

View Event →

Pancake Supper

Come and enjoy a delicious meal of sausage, pancakes, maple syrup and more! A free-will offering will be received.

After the pancake supper you will have the opportunity to receive ashes as part of our “Ashes to Go” service. The liturgy will take place in the church from 6.00 pm to 6.30 pm and again from 7.10 pm to 7.30 pm. This will allow people to receive ashes and begin their Lenten observance even if they are unable to attend our traditional Ash Wednesday Service (which is the next day).

View Event →

Black History Month - African Drumming Session and Dinner

Multi-instrumentalist Sadio Sissoko will set the tone of our month-long Black History Month celebration when he will share his enthusiastic talents on African drums and other instruments. We will then enjoy an African-Caribbean feast from Zimbabwe, Nigeria and the Caribbean. The cost is a free-will offering. For more information please contact the office. We would like to make sure we have enough food for all. So if you would like to come, please register here: https://forms.gle/EaUUdCB4KZoiq7Wb9

View Event →

Family Service

Join us for a family service of games, bible activities and a delicious meal. Activities will include learning a special song for Palm Sunday, games for children (and adults) of all ages, and a time of fellowship. Please register so we have enough food and supplies for everyone at: https://forms.gle/QFM384SPU3dhKeUq7

View Event →

Women's Group Meeting

Women’s Group Meeting

On Sunday after church women of the parish will gather to share insights and ideas to shape the future of our women’s fellowship. Everyone is invited to come. Get your cup of coffee after church, and join us.

Note that the time of the meeting is approximate as it will happen after the 10.00 am service

View Event →

Service of Christmas Carols and Lessons

We will hold our annual service of Christmas carols and lessons with Eucharist on New Year’s day. Join us and come sing and hear the Gospel in music. Note that the end time of the service given is approximate.

View Event →

MONDAY DECEMBER 25 AT 10:00 a.m.

MONDAY DECEMBER 25 AT 10:00 a.m. On Christmas Day there will be a service at 10:00 a.m. I look forward to seeing you at one of the three services, if not all of them.

View Event →

CHRISTMAS EVE SERVICE SUNDAY DECEMBER 24 4:00 p.m. and 8:00 p.m.

Two Christmas Eve services: one at 4:00 p.m. and one at 8:00 p.m. If you are looking for a family service where anything can happen, I encourage you to attend the 4:00 p.m. Just imagine yourself going to a family Christmas dinner. For those who prefer contemplative worship, the 8:00 p.m. service is for you.

View Event →

AN ALTERNATIVE TO CHRISTMAS EXPERIENCE

On Wednesday December 20 we will hold a Eucharist service that honours people that have lost loved ones and are experiencing grief. We will light candles, talk about what we have lost, or what experience has drawn us to the service. And also, the hope found in Jesus.

View Event →

Children's (and others) Christmas Party and Service

Children/youth along with their grownups, and the young at heart, are invited to the Children’s Christmas Service and Party on Saturday, December 16, from 3:00 p.m. until 6:00 p.m. The event will be held in the church hall. There will be games, food and gingerbread houses to be built! The evening will conclude with prayers.

So that we can make sure we have enough food and supplies, please register at this link:

https://forms.gle/2dEgnmMHGAVySUzn8

View Event →

Women's retreat

Come and join the women of St. Stephen’s at a retreat to pray, reflect, enjoy winter activities and have fun. Location is Galilee House in Arnprior. The weekend will be lead by Rev. Claire Bramma, Associate Incumbent of the Parish of the Valley. Please notify the office for information. Planning is underway, so the given start and end times of the retreat are approximate.

View Event →
